page.title: 02WILTSHIRE LOCAL AIR DISPLAY
page.content: At the windy crossroads at the junction of the A360/A344 and B3086 there stands a monument in memory of military flying on Salisbury Plain. As pilots qualified, early test experience was gained in flying over this area. But alas one crashed close to where the monument stands today. Military flying over this area continues today with a wide variety of aircraft. Lynx, Gazelle, Chinook, Puma Wessex and Scout helicopters are used to carry troops and equipment whilst on exercises. Hercules aircraft carry heavy loads and parachutes to the dropping zones. Testing continues too on the Harrier, Buccaneer, Phantom, Jaguar and Tornado, now in service with the R.A.F. in this area. Vapour trails from high-flying airliners i.e.Concorde, V.C.10's etc. en-route to London or the continent can be seen
